test_cases.test_name: Sample Run Schedule Creation and Method Locking
test_cases.objective: Verify that users can create sample run schedules with priority, instrument, and method selections, and that the system enforces method-version locking for scheduled runs.
prerequisites: Access to the Chromatography Sample Scheduling Module

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with appropriate credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and gains access to the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Create a new sample run schedule with priority, instrument, and method selections.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is created and displayed in the system.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version for the scheduled run.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents modification and enforces method-version locking.

acceptance_criteria: Schedule is created successfully
Method-version locking is enforced
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries for schedule changes

test_cases.test_name: Instrument Routing and Availability Rules
test_cases.objective: Verify that the system routes samples to instruments based on configured availability rules and supports pause/resume and re-queue of failed runs with reason capture.
prerequisites: Access to the Chromatography Sample Scheduling Module

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with appropriate credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and gains access to the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Create a sample run schedule and assign it to an instrument based on availability rules.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is assigned to the correct instrument based on availability.

test_steps.action: Simulate a failed run and attempt to pause/resume and re-queue the run.
test_steps.expected_result: System allows pause/resume and re-queue with reason capture.

acceptance_criteria: Samples are routed correctly based on availability rules
Failed runs can be paused/resumed and re-queued
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries for run changes

test_cases.test_name: Verify Method-Version Locking for Scheduled Runs
test_cases.objective: To ensure that the system enforces method-version locking for scheduled runs as per URS-018-002.

test_steps.action: Create a sample run schedule with a specific method version.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is created successfully with the selected method version.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version for the scheduled run.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents modification of the method version and displays an error message.

acceptance_criteria: Method-version locking is enforced for scheduled runs
data_integrity_requirements: Method version integrity must be maintained

test_cases.test_name: Validate Gantt View Refresh Performance
test_cases.objective: To verify that the Gantt view refresh completes within the specified time limit as per URS-018-023.

test_steps.action: Load the Gantt view with a schedule containing 500 samples.
test_steps.expected_result: Gantt view is displayed with all 500 samples.
data_to_capture: Time taken to load Gantt view

test_steps.action: Refresh the Gantt view and measure the time taken.
test_steps.expected_result: Gantt view refresh completes in less than 2 seconds.
data_to_capture: Time taken to refresh Gantt view

acceptance_criteria: Gantt view refresh completes within 2 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Gantt view data must be accurate and up-to-date

test_cases.test_name: Verify Sample Run Schedule Creation with Priority and Method Selection
test_cases.objective: To verify that users can create sample run schedules with priority, instrument, and method selections as per URS-018-001.
prerequisites: Access to the chromatography sample scheduling module
Valid user credentials with schedule creation permissions

test_steps.action: Log in to the chromatography sample scheduling module.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and accesses the scheduling interface.

test_steps.action: Create a new sample run schedule with priority, instrument, and method selections.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is successfully created with the specified priority, instrument, and method.

acceptance_criteria: Schedule is created with correct priority, instrument, and method selections
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure schedule details are accurately captured and stored

test_cases.test_name: Validate Method-Version Locking Enforcement for Scheduled Runs
test_cases.objective: To validate that the system enforces method-version locking for scheduled runs as per URS-018-002.
prerequisites: Access to the chromatography sample scheduling module

test_steps.action: Log in to the chromatography sample scheduling module.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and accesses the scheduling interface.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version of an existing scheduled run.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents modification and enforces method-version locking.

acceptance_criteria: Method-version locking is enforced for scheduled runs
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure method-version locking is accurately enforced

test_cases.test_name: Method Version Locking Verification
test_cases.objective: Verify that the system enforces method-version locking for scheduled runs as per URS-018-002.
prerequisites: User with scheduling permissions is logged in
At least one instrument and method are available

test_steps.action: Create a new sample run schedule and select a method version.
test_steps.expected_result: Method version is successfully selected and locked for the schedule.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version after scheduling.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents modification of the locked method version.

acceptance_criteria: Method version is locked upon scheduling
Modification of locked method version is prevented
Audit trail entry is generated for the lock action
data_integrity_requirements: Method version integrity must be maintained
Audit trail must capture all changes

test_cases.test_name: Schedule Gantt View Performance
test_cases.objective: Verify that the Gantt view refreshes within the required time frame as per URS-018-023.
prerequisites: User with scheduling permissions is logged in
At least 100 sample runs are scheduled

test_steps.action: Navigate to the Gantt view and apply a filter by instrument.
test_steps.expected_result: Gantt view displays filtered schedule within 2 seconds.

test_steps.action: Apply a second filter by analyst and observe refresh time.
test_steps.expected_result: Gantt view updates with new filter within 2 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Gantt view refreshes within 2 seconds for all filters
Filtered data is accurately displayed
data_integrity_requirements: Data displayed must be accurate and current

test_cases.test_name: Schedule Creation and Method Version Locking
test_cases.objective: Verify that users can create sample run schedules with priority, instrument, and method selections, and that the system enforces method-version locking for scheduled runs.
prerequisites: Access to the Chromatography Sample Scheduling Module

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with appropriate user credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and gains access to the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Create a new sample run schedule with priority, instrument, and method selections.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is successfully created with specified parameters.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version for the scheduled run.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents modification and enforces method-version locking.

acceptance_criteria: Schedule creation is successful
Method-version locking is enforced
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries for schedule changes

test_cases.test_name: Instrument Readiness Alerts and Run Completion Notifications
test_cases.objective: Ensure that users receive alerts for instrument readiness and run completion as specified in the requirements.
prerequisites: Access to the Chromatography Sample Scheduling Module

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with appropriate user credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and gains access to the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Schedule a sample run and wait for instrument readiness.
test_steps.expected_result: User receives an alert indicating instrument readiness.

test_steps.action: Complete the scheduled run and wait for run completion notification.
test_steps.expected_result: User receives a notification indicating run completion.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts for instrument readiness are received
Notifications for run completion are received
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries for alerts and notifications

test_cases.test_name: Verify Schedule Creation with Priority and Method Locking
test_cases.objective: To verify that users can create sample run schedules with priority, instrument, and method selections, and that method-version locking is enforced.
prerequisites: User roles and permissions are set up
Instrument and method data are available

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with a user account that has schedule creation permissions.
test_steps.expected_result: User is successfully logged in and can access the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Create a new sample run schedule with priority, instrument, and method selections.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is created successfully with the specified priority, instrument, and method.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version for the scheduled run.
test_steps.expected_result: System enforces method-version locking and prevents modification.
data_to_capture: Error message if modification is attempted

acceptance_criteria: Schedule is created with correct priority, instrument, and method
Method-version locking is enforced
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries are generated for all changes to schedule entries

test_cases.test_name: Validate Integration with Asset System for Instrument Availability
test_cases.objective: To validate that the system can pull instrument availability and calibration status from the asset system.
prerequisites: Asset system is available and configured
Instrument data is available in the asset system

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with a user account that has integration permissions.
test_steps.expected_result: User is successfully logged in and can access the integration module.

test_steps.action: Initiate a request to pull instrument availability and calibration status from the asset system.
test_steps.expected_result: System successfully retrieves instrument availability and calibration status.

test_steps.action: Verify that the retrieved data is correctly displayed in the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Instrument availability and calibration status are correctly displayed in the system.

acceptance_criteria: Instrument availability and calibration status are successfully retrieved
Retrieved data is correctly displayed in the system
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries are generated for all integration actions

test_cases.test_name: Verify Schedule Creation with Priority and Method Locking
test_cases.objective: Ensure that users can create sample run schedules with priority, instrument, and method selections, and that method-version locking is enforced.

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with appropriate credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and accesses the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Create a new sample run schedule with priority, instrument, and method selections.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is created with the specified priority, instrument, and method.

test_steps.action: Attempt to modify the method version for the scheduled run.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents modification and enforces method-version locking.

acceptance_criteria: Schedule is created successfully
Method-version locking is enforced
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all schedule changes are logged in the audit trail

test_cases.test_name: Validate Instrument Readiness Alerts and Run Completion Notifications
test_cases.objective: Verify that users receive alerts for instrument readiness and run completion within the specified time frame.

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with appropriate credentials.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and accesses the scheduling module.

test_steps.action: Schedule a sample run and monitor for instrument readiness alert.
test_steps.expected_result: Alert is received within 5 seconds of instrument readiness.

test_steps.action: Complete the sample run and monitor for run completion notification.
test_steps.expected_result: Notification is received within 5 seconds of run completion.

acceptance_criteria: Alerts and notifications are received within 5 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure all alerts and notifications are logged in the audit trail

test_cases.test_name: Verify Schedule Gantt View Performance
test_cases.objective: Ensure the Gantt view refreshes within the specified time limit under typical load conditions.

test_steps.action: Load a schedule with 500 samples into the system.
test_steps.expected_result: Schedule is loaded successfully without errors.

test_steps.action: Open the Gantt view and filter by instrument and analyst.
test_steps.expected_result: Gantt view displays the filtered schedule correctly.

acceptance_criteria: Gantt view refresh completes in < 2 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure data displayed in Gantt view is accurate and consistent

test_cases.test_name: Validate Integration with Asset System
test_cases.objective: Confirm the system correctly pulls instrument availability and calibration status from the asset system.

test_steps.action: Configure the system to connect to the asset system.
test_steps.expected_result: Connection is established successfully.

test_steps.action: Request instrument availability and calibration status from the asset system.
test_steps.expected_result: Correct instrument status is retrieved and displayed in the system.

acceptance_criteria: Instrument availability and calibration status are accurately pulled from the asset system
data_integrity_requirements: Ensure data retrieved from the asset system is accurate and consistent

test_cases.test_name: Verify Schedule Creation with Method-Version Locking
test_cases.objective: To ensure that the system enforces method-version locking when creating sample run schedules.

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with a user account that has schedule creation permissions.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and navigates to the schedule creation interface.

test_steps.action: Attempt to create a sample run schedule with a locked method version.
test_steps.expected_result: System prevents the creation of the schedule and displays an error message indicating method-version locking.

acceptance_criteria: System enforces method-version locking as expected
Error message is clear and accurate
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries for schedule creation attempts

test_cases.test_name: Validate Gantt View Refresh Performance
test_cases.objective: To verify that the Gantt view refreshes within the specified time limit under typical conditions.

test_steps.action: Log in to the system with a user account that has access to the Gantt view.
test_steps.expected_result: User successfully logs in and navigates to the Gantt view interface.

test_steps.action: Initiate a refresh of the Gantt view and measure the time taken to complete.
test_steps.expected_result: Gantt view refreshes in less than 2 seconds.

acceptance_criteria: Gantt view refresh completes within 2 seconds
data_integrity_requirements: Audit trail entries for Gantt view access

test_cases.objective: To verify that the Gantt view refresh completes within the specified time frame of less than 2 seconds.
